qa.question: What do you mainly use your phone for?
qa.answer: Work calls, location tracking, Google Maps, YouTube, Instagram, Snapchat, Paytm.

qa.question: Do you share your phone with others?
qa.answer: Sometimes my younger brother or colleagues.

qa.question: What are your favorite apps?
qa.answer: YouTube, Google Maps, Snapchat.

qa.question: Do you read permissions?
qa.answer: I read a little, but usually press Allow.

qa.question: How do you decide if an app is safe?
qa.answer: If it’s on Play Store and friends use it.

qa.question: Have you deleted content?
qa.answer: Yes, chats from friends and work screenshots.

qa.question: What do you do before repair?
qa.answer: Remove SIM and memory card, delete chats and photos.

qa.question: Have you asked for help?
qa.answer: Yes, sometimes at mobile shops.

qa.question: Who do you trust most?
qa.answer: In person is best.

qa.question: Do you use code words?
qa.answer: Yes, nicknames in group chats.

qa.question: Have you helped someone install an app?
qa.answer: Yes, I helped my cousin install GPay and WhatsApp.

qa.question: Do you know how to stop permissions?
qa.answer: Yes, I go to settings and turn things off.

qa.question: What do you do with warnings?
qa.answer: I uninstall immediately.

qa.question: What do you think happens when you give access?
qa.answer: I think they store it and use it for ads.

qa.question: Have you hesitated to repair?
qa.answer: Yes, I delay until I remove personal things.

qa.question: Has a repair person opened your gallery?
qa.answer: Yes, once a guy opened WhatsApp while checking.

qa.question: Do you use a password?
qa.answer: Yes, pattern lock and fingerprint for WhatsApp.

qa.question: Do you think local apps are safer?
qa.answer: Not really. I trust international ones more.

qa.question: Who do you turn to?
qa.answer: YouTube tutorials or my cyber café friend.

qa.question: Do people influence your safety thinking?
qa.answer: Yes, my cousin told me not to click unknown links.

scenarios.Broken Phone: Remove SIM, memory card, delete chats/photos before repair.
scenarios.Sharing with Family: If private message comes, I delete it quickly.
scenarios.New App Requesting Permissions: I check reviews and avoid if permissions look fishy.
scenarios.Helping Elderly Relative: I helped my mother with a health app.
scenarios.Using Someone Else’s Phone: If I see something private, I ignore it.
scenarios.Cloud Backup Surprise: I was shocked when deleted photos stayed online.
scenarios.Free Public WiFi: I avoid banking on public WiFi.
scenarios.Friend Needs Help: I send money only to trusted people after confirming.
